Text:
Features

Extremely Deep, Dark & Difficult - Unforgiving in its punishment, yet
rewarding for the determined - learn to strategize freely and conquer
seemingly impossible challenges
Fully Seamless World - Explore a completely integrated world of dark
fantasy where dungeons and areas are seamlessly intertwined, with
great height
Mastery Earns Progression - Contains 60 hours of gameplay, with
nearly 100 uniquely despair-inducing monsters & an incredibly
nuanced RPG systems
Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition will include an untold chapter
in the world of Lordran back to the past, player will discover
the story when Knight Artorias still lives

New Bosses - Including Black Dragon, Sanctuary
Guardian, Artorias of the Abyss
PVP Arena & Online Matchmaking System - Quick matching for
players to play 1vs1, 2vs2 and 4 player battle royal
New Areas - Including Oolacile Township, Oolacile Sanctuary,
Royal Wood, Battle of Stoicism which is the training ground
for online PVP battles
New Enemies - Including Wooden scarecrows,
Chained Prisoner, Stone Knight
New NPCs - Including Hawkeye Gough, Elizabeth
(keeper of the sanctuary
New Weapons and Armor - Equip some from the new
bosses, enemies, and NPCs

So to inform everyone:
The games runs fine and has 30FPS cap as everyone should know by now. Saves are working.

Playing with KeyB+Mouse is horrible, the pointer is kept on the screen, the instructions are with the Xbox controller icons, so it's confusing. Controller is highly recommended.

The locked resolution makes the game looks like crap at higher resolutions, so using the "DSfix" made by the user Durante from the NeoGAF forums is a MUST (It's currently in the 0.2 version "DSfix 0.2"). Using that Mod makes it look gorgeous, just look up the internet for some screen shots, or even better, test it yourself, you won't believe the difference. 

That to tell some of the technical part, since everyone already knows that the game itself it's amazing.

2. Rather than letting your computer autorun Setup.exe, manually execute the "Game.msi" installer.
3. Install the game. It shouldn't ask for a serial.
4. Run the game and make an offline profile.

Hey, how do I use a wired xbox 360 controller w/o using xpadder? I heard it should work by default w/o any soft of keybinding software. Help please?

@Light987
I didn't download this game, so it might be something to do with the game itself, but make sure your 'wired' xbox controller isn't actually wireless, and you're using the charger cable to plug it in to your PC. Your computer recognizes it as a charger and nothing more, and I've heard that you can't use a controller if it is connected by the charger cable. Just a thought :)

SOLUTION for XBOX 360 Controller Issue. 
(Also internal resolution fix info) 

Hello, everyone! 

If you are having an issue simply plugging in and playing this port with your Xbox 360 controller due to wonky controls, please read this. 

1. Go to your Device Manager 
(Control Panel > Device Manager) 

2. Extend the 'Human Interface Devices' collumn and locate 'HID-compliant game controller' and disable it. 

3. Launch the game and play. 

As for the graphics fix: search for Durante's internal rendering resolution fix (DSfix).

Download the latest version and follow the instructions provided.

^ Hope this helps some of you. 

Have a nice day!

OK for those who want to play the game with WSAD+Mouse, there is a way.

Use NoMousy to hide mouse from fullscreen.
http://www.autohotkey.com/community/viewtopic.php?t=2197

Then go in-game and configure keys like a normal WSAD game. Then use Mouse Raider to bind mouse buttons (and axis!) to your keyboard keys.

http://mouseraider.homepage.t-online.de/

It's not even really a port when they haven't made control tips for keyboard (you have to guess the corresponding controller button), frame rate cap (30 fps), and res. cap that needs a mod to be changed. It's more like an emulator. That being said it is superior to the console version, once you have a controller and the fix installed. It's a good thing that it exists, but I can clearly see why someone who paid 40$ would have somewhat mixed feelings about it.

@L1bran
The retard around here is you. It's the company's responsibility to deliver a game that DOESN'T NEED an unofficial FIX to play right. And, really, why should I pay those extra 20$ to play a game just because the developers said so? I won't even mention the shitty frame rate cap. I'd really want to buy this game and support this company, but if they can't do anything right, then no. I won't.

This is a masterpiece of a game, bashed by many for being a horrible port. Yes it is bad, but using a 360 controller and Dsfix (many thanks to its creator) it is perfectly playable (40+ hours of play so far). You will experience the rare fps problems but much less than in the console version. If I had easy access to dollars I would definitely buy this game for the multiplayer. To install I used the 1111... serial and that was it. Follow instructions, use a controller and dsfix and you will have a great time with Dark Souls.

Thanks for this torrent. I have the game for 360, and it's one of my all-time favorites. I downloaded this to see how it worked after all the complaints of it being a shitty port, but after using the dsfix and plugging in my xbox controller, I can confirm this is already the superior version of the game, and I haven't even gotten to the new content yet.

After playing for several hours, it's very legit. I'm actually buying the game now to get access to the online stuff, which is the best part of the game. If you haven't played it before, I would buy it once you get it working because the online capabilities are nuts, and key to the experience.

In case you were going to do so, your save file is in My documents/NBGI/DarkSouls/Fairlight/DRAKS0005.sl2 or a similair file name. So you can pick right up where you left off with all the online stuff active.
